page.title: 18MY DAD'S WORK
page.content:
My Dad is British Telecom Engineering Manager at Swan House, Newcastle. He plans circuits which connect telephone exchanges. Sometimes he has to go to exchanges to see where new equipment has to go. He has to work out the cost Dad told me that modern cables work by sending beams of light down threads of glass instead of the old fashioned cables with electric signals on wires. Dad said when you speak on a telephone the new equipment turns your voice into numbers which are turned back to voice again at the other exchange. We have moved from Pudsey in Yorkshire and now live in a small village near Mickley. My sister and I travel to Mickley School on the bus.
{Christopher Barrett Age 9
